intro: Chrysothamnus parryi var. bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low, spreading growth habit and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xeriscaping and ecological restoration projects.
